projectPurpose: To provide a comprehensive, community-driven directory and curated list of static analysis (SAST) tools and linters for various programming languages, configuration files, and build tools, focused on improving code quality and identifying security vulnerabilities.
mainFeatures: Curated list of static analysis (SAST) tools and linters
Covers a wide range of programming languages, config files, and build tools
Focuses on tools that improve code quality and include SAST capabilities
Serves as an information resource for static analysis (articles, talks, etc.)
Powers the analysis-tools.dev website with additional features like rankings and comments

alternatives.name: OWASP Source Code Analysis Tools
mainFeatures: Lists SAST tools
Includes open-source and commercial options
Part of the broader OWASP effort
Focuses on application security

alternatives.name: GitHub Super Linter
mainFeatures: Bundles multiple linters into a single action
Automates linting in CI/CD workflows
Supports many languages and formats
Configurable via a single action

alternatives.name: SonarQube
mainFeatures: Multi-language static code analysis
Detects bugs, security vulnerabilities (SAST), and code smells
Integrates with CI/CD pipelines
Provides a dashboard for code quality metrics
Supports defining quality gates and profiles

alternatives.name: Veracode Static Analysis
mainFeatures: Enterprise-grade SAST solution
Supports a large number of languages and frameworks
Integrates throughout the SDLC (IDE, CI/CD)
Provides vulnerability remediation guidance
Known for high accuracy and low false positives

alternatives.name: Codacy
mainFeatures: Automated code analysis (SAST, complexity, duplication, coverage)
Supports over 20 programming languages
Integrates with GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket
Provides analysis results directly in pull requests
Includes security analysis checks

marketPositioning: The 'static-analysis' project and its associated website analysis-tools.dev are positioned as a central, comprehensive, and community-driven hub for discovering and comparing a wide array of static analysis tools and linters across diverse technologies. Unlike individual tools that perform analysis (e.g., SonarQube, Veracode), this project acts as a curated directory, providing developers and teams with a valuable starting point to navigate the complex landscape of static code analysis solutions for code quality and security. Its broad scope and community contributions differentiate it from more narrowly focused lists or commercial marketplaces.
